docs.lead_paragraph: SHE calls herself Miss Mary Sunshine. Not because she is popular teenager, which she is, or because she can make a boy's day just by saying hello, which she can, but because of the maple-syrup hue of her skin. Whether she has just been to the Caribbean on a family vacation or has spent the last couple of months cooped up in her Upper East Side apartment with SAT tutors, Miss Mary Sunshine is never without a deep, dark tan. ''I don't like looking at myself when I'm not tan,'' she said. A student at the private Horace Mann School in the Bronx, she spoke on the condition that her name not be used because her mother believes her coppery skin tone comes from a bottle.

headline.main: Young, Carefree and Hooked on Sun Lamps

docs.abstract: Article on continuing rise in number of teenagers across America who have dedicated themselves to pursuing perfect tan, sometimes obsessively, whether from sun or sunlamps; photos (M)
